heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike was on 13 May 2025, at a distance of 4.97 miles.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 20 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (190°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 9.2°C) and outside temperature (down 7.3°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 6804 lux) and cloud levels (up 232 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 145.0m higher than yesterday, 233.8m higher than the past week, 231.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 841m and a high of 1909m, averaging 1605.6m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, dry and less humid conditions and little or no wind. Possible light showers, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and periods of sunshine are expected. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
